alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Otsego; Sullivan (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 21 at 2:26PM EST until February 23 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM WEDNESDAY TO 4 PM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow and sleet accumulations of up to 3 inches and ice accumulations of up to two tenths of an inch. The highest snow and ice accumulations are most likely across elevations above 1400 feet. * WHERE...Otsego, Delaware and Sullivan counties. * WHEN...From 3 PM Wednesday to 4 PM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday evening or Thursday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation starts off as a period of snow, heavy at times Wednesday afternoon. The snow is then forecast to change over to sleet and freezing rain after 4 PM Wednesday. The freezing rain and sleet will change over to rain during the mid to late morning hours on Thursday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
